Subject: Chromebook distribution
Detail:
Jasmynn:

Thanks for meeting with me -- I'm glad to hear you are feeling better.

Here's what we have:


   - The communication I sent to staff is HERE
   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wKXlVqxOWfdfbGaEFpH_-cKLX6eeyIgZgHPFaIMMsgA/edit?usp=sharing>
   - The communication I sent to parents is HERE
   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ezvry4Ziv008Hxg2tDlvb3oAzV8X8e4mgmOIeTV6jSg/edit?usp=sharing>
   - The revised distribution calendar (still tentative) is HERE
   <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IaU5RlMgY65C9LUhXFRqfcQ19HMah0K_FS8ROGB6N3I/edit?usp=sharing>.
   I went 8th grade, then 6th, then 7th, but I pushed the rooms that don't
   currently have carts to the back end of the list. That would be Dunlap
   (8th), Minkens (8th), Calvin/Smith (6th), and Bhatia/Dew (6th)
   - The Response sheet for the Consent form is HERE
   <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-eoHHmgkEKKRWulIGkci77oONgogOk1TLgJWJ0FJ2FE/edit?usp=sharing>


   - We would like a quote on 5 more carts. That would allow us to have one
   cart in each advisory space and one in the main office for tardy scholars.
   As a reminder: kids are allowed to check their devices out to take them
   home, but the default will be for them to be left at school in the carts.
   This makes carts shared across multiple advisory spaces very impractical.
   - We will need locks for the front and back of each cart, so 22-32
   total. I would like locks that are sturdier than the ones we currently have
   -- those can be pulled off without a lot of trouble.

Something else occurred to me: If we want kids to leave these devices at
school, we should have your work in each PMA consist of collecting their
old device and ensuring that the new device for each kid who has the
consent completed goes into the cart. Is there any need for the kids to
handle the devices before the next school day? Let me know what you think.

I received your email about the labels and covers -- I will order those
next week.

Thanks! Hope you are back to full health soon.

Subject: sound issues on PD day
Detail:
Hi everyone,

I'm just writing to share that three of my facilitators today either had to
cancel or use their personal device in order to facilitate their sessions
today. I just learned of these issues today, but what they shared with me
is below. Thanks!

Courtney Tarver @ Butler said she had issues all week and had to keep
restarting her computer. She mentioned that part of her trouble was because
they are currently remote. She had to cancel her sessions.

Janna @ Rauner reported the same issue - having to restart and still not
working. She was on campus and ended up using another device.

Nikki Cavitt @ Noble Street reported the same issue. Victor had given her
another device, but that one then wouldn't start. She had to cancel her
sessions.

Subject: Q2 Network PD Feedback Survey
Detail:
Greetings Noble,



We hope you had a great Network PD! Our feedback survey is linked here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1VHeQBhazIq9znIrAeWVrvBrfkLRRRhHPAQXLHkm6QF8/edit?usp=sharing>.
Please complete and submit the survey for each of your sessions. Your
feedback is greatly appreciated.



You may complete the ISBE Evidence of Completion Form
<https://www.isbe.net/Documents/77-21B_evidence_completion.pdf> for any
synchronous sessions you attend today. Please keep these for your records;
you do not need to turn them in to The Academics Team. While we are remote,
signatures are not required. Please reach out to Myra Mitchell
<mmitchell@nobleschools.org>  with any additional credentialing questions.



Thank you for providing your feedback, so we can continue to improve our
offerings and support.



Take care and Happy Holidays,


Dru

Subject: Support with forwarding emails
Detail:
Hi Hugo,

I hope you are well.

As an update, Nomalanga Shields will transition from Noble officially on
12/30/2021, and her last workday is this Friday, 12/17/2021. Starting on
12/20, may I have you forward all of her emails to Maria Lefkow Sorensen?

Additionally, after the winter break, I will be taking an extended leave
throughout January. Maria and Lorri will be stepping in to support me while
I am out of the office. Would it be possible to have my emails forwarded to
them starting on 12/20 as well? I will be receiving important updates from
donors and about grants, so I'd love to make sure someone from my team can
receive these when I am out.

Thank you for your support and please do not hesitate to let me know if any
questions or concerns come up.

Best,
Sandy

Subject: Intercom Not Working ALL YEAR-SAFETY HAZARD
Detail:
Hello all,

Our intercom has not been audible all year. We have sent multiple emails to
Johnson and Muchin Maintenance about this problem. One semester of the
school year has almost passed and there have been a multitude of Code
Oranges/Blues and a Red. When Lockhart gave the 8 minute long announcement,
our students missed out. I asked Johnson if we should move to an alternate
location in advance, but he thought the speaker was working. It wasn't.

At this point, I don't know what to do. We don't feel safe. Our students do
not feel safe. We have been reassured on multiple occasions not to worry
and that it is a top priority on the list of things to be fixed....and yet
it still does not work.

How can we expedite this process for the safety of our students?

Best,
*Francesca Tomic (she/her/hers)*
Multilingual Teacher
Noble Network Charter Schools

Subject: Dual credit Biology resources
Detail:
Hi team -

Parker and I just finished our call with Harold Washington regarding the curriculum for dual credit bio, and we have a few online resources that we’ll need for the course:  

(1) e-learning program (one for each student - 5): https://www.pearson.com/us/higher-education/product/Simon-Modified-Mastering-Biology-with-Pearson-e-Text-Instant-Access-for-Biology-The-Core-3rd-Edition/9780135308622.html?tab=overview  

(2) Electronic textbook teachers edition: https://www.pearson.com/us/higher-education/product/Simon-Instructor-Guide-Download-only-for-Biology-The-Core-3rd-Edition/9780135308769.html

I am including the help desk here in place of the main office order request in case the purchase requires being loaded directly onto student/teacher computers.  

cq

Subject: MiFi for SSM Issues
Detail:
Hey James!

In my newsletter this week, Bianca said that IT was manned with a few MiFis
to help with our connection to the CPS network. I have the blurb from her
below. How many do we have to supply the Learning Specialists? I wanted to
offer this as a way around the connection issues, but wanted to know how I
should go about it.

Thanks!


   -

   SSM sign-in issues (Ongoing): Our iTeam at the Network level has been
   working to resolve the issue so many have reported with logging into and
   navigating SSM. Additionally, they are working with CPS’s IT Department and
   have ruled out it is a Noble network/internet issue. Here are some updates
   and reminders…
   -

      All staff should report issues and occurrences directly to their IT
      Lead’s  help desk
      -

      An interim workaround; for those that can connect with a MiFi; we
      connect them manually to a printer so they can  print documents.  We will
      make sure the IT Leads have this option ready to try out immediately.
      -

      This appears to be a complex issue related to the CPS application and
      we will need to rely heavily on CPS/ITS for a solution, which
can take time

Subject: Testing Computers/Chromebooks
Detail:
Hey Veleta!

I hope the week is off to a good start!  We will be doing Q2 interim
testing starting Thursday for our Audio testers.

I am writing because I anticipating needing ~20 or so chromebooks or
computers for students to test on.

They have all been told to bring their personal chromebooks, but given how
last time went, we will need some spares. Last time they received the same
messaging and we needed about 20 computers.

I was told there were either laptops or chromebooks set aside for testing.
If this is the case, please let me know where to locate them.

If this is not the case, we will need to use the loaner comps from the
office and communicate that there aren't any loaners on Thursday.

Thank you for all you do, and please let me know when you get a chance.

Subject: 12th grade PJ party Friday
Detail:
Hi Eric and Dustin!

Since I am out this week, I wanted to give some notes for the 12th grade
Friday PJ party on Friday that you both will be running for the seniors
while other students are testing. I'm sorry I won't be there to help!!

The general gist is that all the seniors are in the SC for the day and
there are holiday movies playing, kids get to chill, and we order them
pizza!

1) Brian, including you to check that the student center tech is working to
show movies. I know we have been having some issues with it the past few
weeks. Thank you!! Eric/Dustin, if Brian tells us it isn't working, you can
move to LH (but that isn't quite as fun, so hopefully SC works!)

2) I was going to order pizza for the seniors during the PJ party from
DeArcos. I would reach out to the ops team if you want help coordinating
this. Just make sure that students distance themselves how they would
during lunch to eat when the pizza comes.

3) The 12th graders voted for holiday movies a few weeks ago. One of you
will have to hook up your computer to play the movies. If you have to rent
any of them on Amazon, fill out the reimbursement form or get the school

Subject: Browser Lockdown Modes
Detail:
Hi, Mr. Diaz

I have gotten questions regarding locking the browsers for when students
take assessments.  Currently, some students are going to other tabs while
taking assessments to look up answers.  I reached out to the Formative
folks to inquire about this, and this is the response I received:


   - Browser lockdown modes are available, but are designed to be used for
   infrequent, school-wide high stakes testing. They require a school IT
   administrator to turn it on and off, so it's not something the teachers can
   do at their leisure.


Is there a way you can do this?

Subject: New Student (9th)- M.Carter
Detail:
Hi everyone,

We have a new student joining us! Mohogany Carter is a 9th grader who
started some of her courses today by shadowing Linsey Lozoya. Mohogany was
an intercampus transfer, so the transfer procedures/timeline is a bit
different. Sorry for the short notice! She is our only intercampus transfer
at this time.

Please see notes/requests below:

Teachers- please update seating charts as needed and exempt student from
past assignments.

Tatroe- This student will be joining your advisory! I would like their
advisory buddy to be Linsey Lozoya for the day as they will have the same
schedule. Please introduce them in AMA and ask Linsey to show them the
ropes throughout the day. I am putting a copy of their schedule in your
mailbox to give to them their first day in AMA.

Operations- I am checking to see if this student still has their chromebook
from their previous noble school and will report back.

Brian- Can you give them PS/Email accounts and share that info with Tatroe?
Can you also add them to the appropriate grade-level email tree? And
lastly, can you create an authenticated Noble Zoom account for them?

Culture team- Can you assign him a locker/lock and share that info with
their new advisor?

The student’s schedule will be the following:

Mogohany Carter

Buddy: Linsey Lozoya

Course

Teacher

Room

Subject: Questions Regarding Spam Newsletters
Detail:
Hello -

I am an associate at the Alumni Career Office and I am looking for some
support on an issue I've experienced with third-party newsletters that are
sent to spam.

Once monthly, we send our email newsletter to around 18,000+ emails from
MailChimp. While preparing this month's newsletter, I realized that the
emails are now going to spam for gmail accounts which impacts over 70% of
our alumni contacts. We have never experienced this issue before. I have
tried a number of different changes to content, subject line, and audience,
but every change results in the same.

From looking into the issue, there are a few different reasons this could
be happening. When test emails come to my work email, the reason given for
going to spam says it's because it's like other emails that have been
flagged as spam in the past. When it goes to my personal email, however,
the reason given is the system couldn't verify that the email came from
alumnicareers@nobleschools.org. One reason could be our domain, which for
MailChimp is currently just nobleschools.org, not being verified. According
to mailchimp account settings, nobleschools.org is still verified, but I'd
like to get this checked if possible.

The other option was the IP address being blocked or flagged as having sent
spam before OR our alumnicareers@nobleschools.org email having experienced
the same issue. So I wanted to check and see if the IP address being used
or our email account has been flagged. Is this something that can be
checked?

The only change that was made between this month and last month was a new
audience that was imported into mailchimp using CSV, but even using other
audiences results in the newsletter going to spam.

I am happy to jump on a call as well if needed to explain the details too.

Best -
Yasmeen

Subject: ID Card Printer
Detail:
Hi OB!

I attempted to print ID cards for our students last week and ran into two
major issues I'd like to problem solve with you:

1) The computer currently attached to the printer was exceedingly slow. I
don't know if this was a wifi/website issue or a device issue, but I could
select at most 25 cards at a time to print, and even that would take long
stretches of time to get sent to the printer.

2) The printer itself, which is brand new, jammed many many times in the
process. Each time it seemed like the printer tried to run two cards at
once. This was hard to rectify and also slowed down the process.

I spent all day Thursday trying to print and ultimately got through fewer
than 100 because of these issues. Can you check in today to see if we can
solve them and finish the printing this week?

Thank you!

Nicole

Subject: 317 Document Camera
Detail:
Hey Steve,

My document camera (Elmo TT-02RX) has appeared to stop working in room 317.

When the device is turned on, it does not appear to be sending a signal. It
is clear that the device is sending SOMETHING, because it changes the
projector from the blue "no input detected" to black. I've tried adjusting
the settings. I've tried double checking that the wires are plugged in
correctly. I've tried unplugging it and letting power cycle.

I've also double checked to make sure that the projector cable itself is
also working. When plugging my computer directly into it, it DOES display.
I've been using that method for now as a work around.

Do you think you could check it out at some point? I don't know how old the
device is, but it has been here since at least before I started here.

Thanks!
Daniel

Subject: 3rd period AP Classroom connectivity issues
Detail:
Hi Everyone!

This is such a strange issue and I don't know what the cause or what
possible solutions are so I really need your help! :-)

Mr. Foulks has been working SOOOOO hard to get his students logged in to AP
Classroom so they can register for their AP exam. But he keeps running into
issues during 3rd period, specifically.

I pulled students this morning to bring them into the hallway -- hoping a
change of venue might resolve the issue -- but the same thing kept
happening: *students would continually get a spinning circle showing the AP
Classroom site was loading and loading and loading and . . . *

So, 1) I'm not sure why this is occurring and 2) I don't know how to fix
it. We need to have all students registered for their AP courses so I can
submit our order without incurring a $40 fee per test.

Any thoughts on our possible next steps?

Thank you!
Laura :-)

Subject: <Urgent> Locking Cabinet for Macbook & Cameras
Detail:
Hi Diana,

I just wanted to follow up on the ask I sent over from a few weeks ago
regarding a secure space to store supplies, and the spare laptop for using
the adobe creative cloud:

Hector brought me the Macbook after the all-staff, but had to take back the
spare HP laptop because we haven't received your approval. *Seeing as
students will not have the creative cloud on their chromebooks (the
chromebook isn't strong enough for the software), we need at least one
other device that students can use to do the following:*
-Put together the magazine (adobe indesign)-- E-board members will be using
this before/ after school hours
-Edit photos for the magazine and yearbook (adobe photoshop)--
photographers for the magazine & yearbook will be using this during the
school day AND before/ after school hours
- Create & edit podcasts (garage band or audacity)-- journalism students
will be using this during the school day and after school hours.

* Any time a students is using the device they will be supervised by me in
118.

To summarize, the program of over 200 students only has one device where
students can access these platforms.

That in mind, there is now over $4000 worth of supplies in 118 and there
isn't a secure space where these products can be held (I brought the
Macbook home this weekend so it wouldn't be left in the room
unprotected.) *Would
it be possible to get a new lock for my current file cabinet, or a cabinet
that locks so I may store these devices? *I do not want to  be held
responsible if something were to happen to these items while I'm not in the
building, nor would I want students to lose the opporyunity to learn these
skills.

*Please let me know how to proceed, or what I can do to help you make this
work. *I will happily fill out/ sign any paperwork needed so these items
are protected.

Feel free to give me a call or shoot me a text should you want to discuss
this further.


Best,

Despina

Subject: Email trees for more efficient targeted emails <Action Requested>
Detail:
Hey ALT,

Sending this quick email so that we don't have to spend too much time on it
during our leadership team meeting tomorrow.  *I want us to move forward
with creating email trees for our teams and for the different subteams so
that not everything has to be sent to the all staff email.* For example- if
we need to send a message to the 7th grade teachers we should have an email
address that is for that group.

*Here's what I need each of you to do :*
1. Consider the teams or groups you manage or that communicate with most.
2. Identify the members of that group ( i.e. 6th grade advisors)
3. Send the name of the group and the names of its members to @gcms help
<gcms-help@catamounts.org> so that Jasmynn (copied here) can build an email
tree for that team.
4. Copy Brad on that send so that he can track these trees as part of our
staff directory .


If it's helpful, below are some ideas for trees that would make our email
systems more efficient. This is a non exhaustive list so feel free to
request the trees you want and need most. I have already submitted a
request for us to have an ALT tree as well.

Finally, there are some teams that already have trees that might not be
used with fidelity. When you submit your names and list, @Gist, Jasmynn
<jgist@nobleschools.org> will double check to make certain that there isn't
already a tree or that it is updated accordingly.

Potential Trees:
- each grade level advisory team
- one for all advisors
- each grade level team
- departments
- grade level leads
- advisory leads
- culture team
- mtss team


Let me know if you have questions,
Hemingway

the junior year.  To expedite processing of Jorge's application and assist
in his/her selection to his/her first choice NROTC unit, please complete as
soon as possible. Please complete this evaluation on-line.  This is the
preferred method.  You may also request a paper copy to complete and return
to me by mail.  My contact information is at the bottom of this letter.
        Instructions for completing the evaluation are as follows - the
process should not take more than a few minutes to complete:
                1. Go to
https://netfocus.netc.navy.mil/NROTC/login2/nrotc.aspx   This web site is a
Department of Defense secure server site. You may get a browser pop-up
saying that the server certificate could not be verified. Do not be
alarmed. The US Government does not pay outside companies like Verisign to
'certify' our servers. Please accept the certificate (it's just like
accepting US Government issued money) and continue the evaluation. Click on
the Non_PKI Enabled Version and type in the following user name: and
password: or request a paper version of the evaluation by phone.
                2. Please fill in your name, title and phone number.
                3. Please indicate how long you have known this student.
                4. Please enter the requested information, including
(cumulative GPA, rank in class and school ETS code.
                5. Please provide a short written evaluation of the
student.  It would be helpful for us if you comment on any or all of the
following areas: the student's current or past performance, academic
ability, character, integrity, leadership, and potential for success in a
demanding academic environment.  If you do not wish to make any written
statements the computer will prompt you to enter at least one word.  You
may state "Decline to comment" or "Comments Attached" as appropriate.
                6. After you have finished and reviewed your comments,
please click on the submit button.  Once you have submitted your comments,
you will not be able to access the evaluation again.
                7. Please authorize and release Jorge Bustamante's
secondary school transcript to the NROTC local processing center.


                        Thank you for your time.

                Captain Alexander M. Pecoraro
                2400 E. Devon Ave, Suite 355
                Des Plaines, IL  60018
        847.803.6373
                alexander.pecoraro@marines.usmc.mil

Subject: Issues with Cameras
Detail:
Sorry for the late notice, we have been having issues with our cameras.
They record in spurts with missing footage. Also in between the missing
footage we are having issues where the came shots become over-pixelated and
as an over-pixelated person walks across the screen it pixelates the rest
of the screen. It makes it nearly impossible to view live video and
especially review footage. When we had the cameras installed we requested
to have an in-house DVR for the storing and reviewing of the cameras and
footage to prevent issues like this. I'm not sure if it would be possible
to do that at this point or not, but at this point the way the cameras are
recording footage, it would be similar to not having any at all.

Subject: Q1 2021-2022 PD Feedback Survey & Evidence of Completion Form
Detail:
Greetings Noble,



We're looking forward to seeing you in today's Network PD sessions! Our
feedback survey is linked here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/17IctvbfUqADDTH6kdpeGwTZs7GAHqW6FcWJQFRX84jM/edit?usp=sharing>.
Please complete and submit the survey after each of your sessions.



You may complete the ISBE Evidence of Completion Form
<https://www.isbe.net/Documents/77-21B_evidence_completion.pdf> for any
synchronous sessions you attend today. Please keep these for your records;
you do not need to turn them in to The Academics Team. While we are remote,
signatures are not required. Please reach out to Myra Mitchell
<mmitchell@nobleschools.org>  with any additional credentialing questions.



Thank you for providing your feedback, so we can continue to improve our
offerings and support.



Take care,

Subject: Extra 2 Laptops for Journalism/ Locking Cabinet
Detail:
Hi Diana,

Happy Friday! I hope you are doing well.

Since we now have the Adobe creative cloud (THANK YOU FOR THAT) It would be
really useful if 118 had 2  HP laptops for students to use and practice
with new creative platforms. The cloud is large and difficult to navigate
on a chromebook.  As you know, non-phone tech doesn't always come easy for
our students, so I want to make sure we are able to put together the
magazine and get it to print as soon as possible.

Especially while we await the Macbook and students are finishing up their
articles, I want the kids to start familiarizing themselves with these
platforms so there are minimal bumps in the road when it comes time to
print.

*There isn't a need to purchase any laptops, as there already are  a few
extras in the tech office. Would it be ok if hector adds the creative cloud
to those laptops, and we use them in 118?*

Also, With all the tech in this room, none of the cabinets lock (I never
got any keys for either cabinet in my room). Would it be possible to have
new locks made for these cabinets, are there any locking ones somewhere
that I can have to store all the tech? My room is often used by the church
and while I doubt something would happen, I just want to be sure. Please
let me know how to proceed, and I will create a maintenance ticket based on
your guidance.

Thank you so much in advance, and for your continuous support.

Best,

Subject: Laptop Lagging
Detail:
Hey Josh,

How are you? I'm continuing to have issues with my laptop where the CPU
usage goes to 100% and stays there, unless I close out every Google Chrome
window. The issue makes my computer essentially unusable, as it can't
connect to the internet during these times when it's lagging. I end up just
having to wait it out, which can take several minutes, unless I close out
all of my Chrome windows. See the attached screenshot for what I'm seeing
in the Task Manager.

This issue has bee leading to interruption in completing my duties for
several months now, but especially in the last couple months, the timing
has been poor, since it can happen at any time. Is there anything you can
do to correct this issue?

- Amit

--

Subject: Problems viewing Youtube videos
Detail:
Good morning,

I am trying to complete the trainings for Title IX and Covid protocols
through the Vector system. I keep getting the following error message when
trying to view the videos:

Video unavailable
This video is restricted. Please check the Google Workspace administrator
and/or the network administrator restrictions.


Please advise. I received an email a while back about some restrictions I
may have using Youtube, which seemed odd. It seemed like a message students

Subject: Problems with Impact/SSM Login and use
Detail:
Hi Jorge and Tech Team Friends,

I was reaching out to follow up on a conversation that I started with Jorge
in person the other day regarding issues many of us at the OC are
experiencing with accessing SSM/Impact.

Corynn Ginnow and I have both been trying to login over the past few days,
and it seems that depending on the time of day, there are times where we
can't get in.

We also always have to start the process using the BIP-IP Edge Client and
then switch from Internet Explorer to Chrome to be able to access it at all
when it does work.

Also, Corynn Ginnow's laptop has a popup that keeps coming up regularly
from the BIP-IP Edge Client. It comes up a lot even once she closes it
out.  This same issue used to happen on my laptop as well, but now it
doesn't ever come up any more.

There are also times where one of us can log in but the other one of us
can't.  I'm also aware that there are a number of learning specialists who
are struggling to get into SSM/Impact as well.

Can you help us resolve these issues?

Thanks so much,
Josh

always. I'm on the most updated version. Please let me know if there's
anything else I can try.

Thanks!
Sue

Subject: Temporarily reinstate James McCoyne email account
Detail:
Hi Steve,

Please see below from Sarah MacCallum from NST - can you reinstate James
McCoyne's work account so that he can upload letters of recommendation this
week?

Thank you,
Megan

---

*Thanks for taking my quick call earlier! Like I mentioned on the phone,
CPS will not allow Naviance accounts to be created using personal email
addresses. Instead, we'll have to request that James's email address be
temporarily re-opened so you can reset his PW, then he can log on using
that PW to upload his letters (or your team can do it for him on his
behalf). *

*Please send an email to U-help requesting that James's email be
temporarily re-opened for the purpose of updating his Naviance PW. Share
that you know that I've been in contact with Tony Briscoe for similar
situations at Bulls & Golder. In those cases, the email address was
temporarily re-opened, the dean updated the PW using "forgot my PW" and
then the account was closed again. If your tech person has questions, they
can email Briscoe directly.*



*This should take care of it! Let me know if you have any questions or want
me to loop in Briscoe on my end. I'm happy to do it!*
*Thanks,*
*Sarah*

Subject: mastery manager hardware request
Detail:
I'm sending this as both an official request and to make sure there isn't a
better option in the classroom. We want to use a scanning daily check quiz
setup for students to have written-on quizzes for both conceptual and
mathematical questions and we've realized that our best option is Mastery
Manager. This program is limited to only specific scanning devices (iOS and
Google) and so we can't use the HP laptops that you provided us.
It would be great if Marquise and I were able to get a pair of chromebooks
for them to be stationed in our room for daily scanning by students when
they finish their quizzes. One caveat is that we would either need access
to the google play account on them or for the "SmartScan Go" program to be
installed.

Hope you can help us. I know we're pretty backlogged with getting
chromebooks to kids so please let us know if this can't happen in the
near future.

Thanks,

Brian Stachowiak
Chemistry Instructor
*Mansueto High School*
*Noble Network of Charter Schools*

Subject: Network Access Improvement Ticket, Room 279
Detail:
Hi Bryan,

I was hoping perhaps we could look at finding a way to install something
near my room that might help the network connectivity (Noble Staff Cloud).
There have been numerous times where the connection has loaded slowly, or
has been lost altogether. I believe this may be due to the location of my
office in the far corner of Obama Hall.

A reliable network connection is critical for my role as Special Education
Director, as I will be conducting and facilitating the vast majority of our
IEP meetings virtually. Additionally, I will be using this space to
collaborate with my team of Learning Specialists, academic coaches, grade
level deans, among other admin. There are also various personal development
training videos and collaboration tools that require a strong network and
bandwidth from my office to participate in.

I understand this may take time as you may need to discuss options with
your team. Please keep me updated with how the issue can be resolved.

Thank you!

Andre Berg

Subject: Adobe monthly subscription vs software
Detail:
Dear Jose,
Greetings! I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to reach out and ask
about my Adobe subscription. I pay monthly for Adobe XI Pro. Its about
fifteen dollars a month. I use it to help alumni fill out forms and
complete requests that I get for records and other things alumni-related.
The basics I use it for are filling in and signing forms, merging PDFs, and
resizing PDFs to be able to be uploaded to college portals. During the
pandemic, it was very helpful to help alumni complete verification
paperwork via Zoom. I'm wondering if you think I should continue paying the
monthly subscription or if I can get it installed permanently and not have
to pay to use it every month. Enjoy the rest of your day!

Subject: Computer is having issues
Detail:
My computer has been having issues since we came back to school.

I made a purchase on Teacherpayteachers, which is a safe website for
teacher materials and lesson plans. One of the files was a zipfile which
kept saying it could not download because "Failed-Network Error." I tried
to download it several times until it told me I didn't have permissions. I
have ordered so many things from that website, and have downloaded things
from multiple websites and never have had that problem. When I was finally
able to unzip the file, it created HTML Chrome files, but kept telling me
"Windows cannot complete the extraction because the destination file could
not be completed."

In addition, anytime I try to stream something, it stalls and buffers
continuously. I've never had that happen before. Others listen to music on
their computers with no buffering.

Also, there is a delay when I try to get to websites. This is also
happening when I am here after hours and no one else is here.


Besides all that, my space bar is not working on my computer, and neither
is my mouse.

Subject: Google Drive issue
Detail:
Hello team,

Both Amber Johnson and I are having issues with google docs (specifically
forms). For starters, when we try to create a new Form in Drive we get this
error message. I can create new sheets, docs, slides just not Forms. When
we try to open some of our google forms we get the same error message
(while others work ok).

We had a teammate test a form
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf1KPD-FWwSdtZKfKc02TH5xlldjlcIjiLCTWQQiwgpf73eVg/viewform>

it. Both Amber and I got the email notification that the form was submitted
(and we can see the response data in the linked sheet) but when we clicked
on the response link in the body of the email...same error message.

with no problem.

We are really struggling to identify the issue.

Detail:

Veleta Spruille

Senior Information Technology Team Lead

Noble Network of Charter Schools

(312) 848-8753

 <mailto:vspruille@nobleschools.org> vspruille@nobleschools.org

 

From: Peterson, Theresa <tpeterson@nobleagcollegeprep.org>  
Sent: Wednesday, September 8, 2021 9:54 AM
To: Spruille, Veleta <vspruille@nobleschools.org>
Subject: WIDA AMS Updates

 

Hi Veleta,

 

Happy Wednesday!  

 

I need to have at least one cart of chromebooks updated with the new WISA AMS software.  I cannot complete the screeners (due by 10/1) or the ACCESS testing (done in semester 2) until the chromebooks receive the update.   

 

I have no preference on which cart of chromebooks gets the update, I just need to know which one so I can ensure that is the one I reserve for testing.   

 

Directions can be found here to update software on Windows <https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vxGNMZ7K_LGg_vD8fzV9BjtoUShzQMy6/view?usp=sharing>  and Chromebooks <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Prz3johQPeVCAiOGOL-Z0vjkzuhHk7QtQA3kYQSFFRk/edit?usp=sharing> .

 

Thank you so much and please let me know if you have any questions or if there is anything I can do to help.

 

Tracy

Detail:
Hugo, putting this back on our radar. Setup a meeting with Djougine when
she's in the office and brainstorm putting her suggestions in place and
offer best routes.

From: St-Hilaire, Djougine <dsthilaire@nobleschools.org>
Date: Wed, Jun 2, 2021 at 4:03 PM
Subject: Project Request Automatic phone answering -Long email alert
To: Jasmynn Gist <jgist@nobleschools.org>
Cc: Tony Briscoe <tbriscoe@nobleiteam.com>, Bonet, Celise <
cebonet@nobleschools.org>


Hi there,


We have been thinking about changing the format for our mainline
(312-521-5287 line) calls for next year. We want to give callers options
when they call the mainline for NST to serve our stakeholders better. Not
immediate right now. I would like to have it all finalized *by August 1*,
if possible. People will leave a message or someone from any of those
team's direct lines will answer? These are just the preliminary stages. How
can I go about that? Please see the below examples:


Option 1-Enrollment-1-833-Be Noble

Option 2- Careers office

Option 3- Human Ressources Team

Option 4- Finance Team-Administration

Option 5-Technology-Vendors line to leave a message -someone will check it
.regularly

Option 6- Schools- Campuses- Alphabetical order for the caller to press
options? I don't foresee 18 different options, but I am sure we will
develop a great idea.

**Raise a concern or to speak to someone at NST Main Office press 0

I am copying Tony; I think this might include certain teams and
collaborations. It will change certain norms around to serve our students
and our community better.


Thank you,

Subject: Student Chromebook sign out when idle
Detail:
Hi Ms. Brewer.  Since we moved to a 1:1 chromebook system, I was thinking
it may be good to consider changing the auto logout settings for student
chromebooks.  Since students are using the same chromebook all day, it may
be good to allow them to stay signed in even when closing the lid between
classes.  Last spring, I saw a lot of students walking around with their
chromebooks open to avoid being logged out.

Thoughts on this?  I would suggest that the chromebook sleep and lock when
the screen is closed but not log them out.

Best,
JB

Subject: Youtube Account Access
Detail:
Hello Veleta,

I received this email from YouTube and thought I would send it to you as it
is likely the reason myself and other teachers were unable to access
certain videos last school year. I'm hoping we will be able to figure this
out so that it doesn't impact the content that we use in our classrooms.

Thanks so much,

Christine Saltsider


Hi Christine,

?

We’re reaching out because you use YouTube at school with a Google Workspace
for Education
<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/AD-FnEyc-hYGrGX6ASNbVhWrnOwWl9YPOr_hQPvp_95fQUfXfNLNSYLe5-ZjNUimojSnH8lHAQKu3-nqsEkGE2Svw9Q7pTddcYBk907Fu0Ot-qtV1shQoI8kke9C97DYVcRgs18ww9OdHrZd8KRIJCGVMkcmjDqL3jwxBgoXGlI>
account.
In this type of account, you use your school email address, and your school
administrator
<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/AD-FnExiqNZEePvdCVl6GgvwnSEHTsfjSJQMmuymIhalC5ARKkK9dLGXzmpTw-9o7cPRbge9uOc2yPf6jeHW49HT3FSB4NxVDDLPftI9iuJBGS7DkSetZtYSzvTLpn2koMYfbGpc12qa>
manages
your access to Google products like YouTube.

?

*Starting in the coming weeks:* Because your school admin has marked you as
under 18 years old, *you’ll see a new, limited version of YouTube designed
for schools when you use your school account*. This means you won’t be able
to do things like comment, live chat, or receive most notifications
<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/AD-FnEwnrywnQe5xmW_U2V48fo5MTGSeyAhZ-ZJofUBEyNnpkzLqe4M9sLckHNz99nfIt8JeHx1ARf78W5CYGia2c6RxDaJCeYSwmG-hHNLylBKRzowWggg9aGpAftUrar9dRPvCjA>.
You also won’t be able to create YouTube videos and may not be able to
watch certain videos.

?

This new experience is automatically given to students marked as under 18.
But this only impacts your YouTube experience on your school account and *does
not impact the YouTube experience on your personal account*.

?

If you have uploaded videos to your school YouTube account, your channel
will be hidden. You can download and save your videos using Google Takeout
<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/AD-FnEyCcZd1vWsjqxVfwQicD7vCLEZdBiFjfH6oWQ1HXCc72fe_TeDjWXtqJJoskfGUIxtciEF5V2wwS6iwFBRr4rv2p7bk75k0LJQvDJOwg5M>
(when
turned on by your admin).

?

In the coming months we will also be launching a tool that will allow you
to directly move videos from your school account channel to a personal
account. We will reach out with more details when the tool opens.

?

For more info on your school YouTube account, please visit our Help Center
<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/AD-FnEwnrywnQe5xmW_U2V48fo5MTGSeyAhZ-ZJofUBEyNnpkzLqe4M9sLckHNz99nfIt8JeHx1ARf78W5CYGia2c6RxDaJCeYSwmG-hHNLylBKRzowWggg9aGpAftUrar9dRPvCjA>
.

?

Thanks,
The YouTube team

Subject: Webinar License - DACA/Immigration

immigration/DACA briefing on Thursday, September 16th, where we will
provide a secure and anonymous space for our families to receive answers
from pro bono lawyers.

*With that being said, I will need to request a webinar license*, we will
be opening this invitation to all Noble School + Noble Alumni. Please let
me know if you have any questions or concerns.

As always, thank you for your support!

Luis

thought. I've broken down the issues that I have founds.

*Issues with RCP Student Logins*

Issue #1 - On the Class 2025 tab here
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MxG04g5l450dGmEldhDWhMm_fnw-N5Ztgm917M8awrY/edit#gid=917975828>,
we have a bunch of students without emails or password.
Issue #2 - On the Class 2025 tab here
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MxG04g5l450dGmEldhDWhMm_fnw-N5Ztgm917M8awrY/edit#gid=1610681004>,
there is no user name listed. Instead, we have something called CB Asset#.
What is that?
Issue #3 - Transfer students are not listed here
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MxG04g5l450dGmEldhDWhMm_fnw-N5Ztgm917M8awrY/edit#gid=970352974>
.
Issue #4 - Advisor fields are wrong for many students on all tabs here
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MxG04g5l450dGmEldhDWhMm_fnw-N5Ztgm917M8awrY/edit#gid=970352974>(it
looks like they never get cleaned up.

*Issues with Quick Export Fields (see attached file)*
Issue #1 - Attached spreadsheet has a student who doesn't have a web ID
Issue #2 - Attached spreadsheet shows students who have nothing come up for
the quick export field of "Student_Web_Password"
Issue #3 - This may not be an issue, but a handful of students who are
intercampus transfers have passwords related to their last campus when I
pull Student_Web_Password. They are in a separate tab. Can you please
confirm if these are correct?

Subject: Zoom Account 

Hi Louise, 

We have set up a Zoom account for you.  Please follow the steps to set up your account.

How to create a Zoom account under the Network-wide contract if you do not currently have one

Open your web browser.

Go to https://nobleschools-org.zoom.us

Click on “Sign in with your Noble account”

You will be redirected to Noble’s self-service web portal.  

Sign into the portable using your network user ID and password (which is the same as your Powerschool name and pw).

You should now be successfully signed in to Zoom.

Please submit a request to IT if you have any trouble whatsoever with this process.  

Let me know if you have any questions.  


Thank you,

Veleta Spruille

Senior IT Manager | iTeam

Noble Schools | www.nobleschools.org

312.848.8753 |vspruille@nobleschools.org

Subject: Zoom Account
Detail:
Hi Louise, 

We have set up a Zoom account for you.  Please follow the steps to set up your account.

How to create a Zoom account under the Network-wide contract if you do not currently have one

Open your web browser.

Go to https://nobleschools-org.zoom.us

Click on “Sign in with your Noble account”

You will be redirected to Noble’s self-service web portal.  

Sign into the portable using your network user ID and password (which is the same as your Powerschool name and pw).

You should now be successfully signed in to Zoom.

Please submit a request to IT if you have any trouble whatsoever with this process.  

Let me know if you have any questions.  


Thank you,

Veleta Spruille

Senior IT Manager | iTeam

Noble Schools | www.nobleschools.org

312.848.8753 |vspruille@nobleschools.org

Subject: Macbook Screen Damage
Detail:
Good afternoon! 

Yesterday afternoon, I discovered that the screen of my MacBook Pro (issued Feb. 2021) suffered some staining, I assume from a water bottle that leaked into the main compartment of my backpack on the commute home. The MacBook's ports/hardware/battery are fully functional save for the aesthetic integrity of the screen.  I've attached photos of the screen for context. If the repair protocol allows it, I am more than willing to take the device to the Apple Store myself for an LCD replacement. Otherwise, I can back up my files to Google Drive and submit the device for repairs and/or manage with the stained screen.

Subject: SRI (Scholastic Reading Inventory)
Detail:
Hey team,

So in the transition from Sean to Friendella, I think we might have missed
the ordering of the Lexile testing online software for this school year.
I've cc'ed Mann and Hernandez on this email because we are signed up for a
literacy pilot and I want to make sure we aren't double ordering this
software.

We are planning on having all our students this year take a lexile test
sometime this year, but most urgently we have our 9th grade students slated
to take the test on September 7th in the afternoon. Gives us three weeks to
get it purchased and up and running, and if I remember correctly this is a
very doable deadline.

Mann and OB, can you double check to make sure the websites below are the
ones that we used last year with Forester and that we haven't already
purchased? I believe to be the website we used last year:
https://www.hmhco.com/programs/reading-inventory#overview

Friendella, once Mann and OB gives us the green light that this is the
correct program, can you fill out this contact form about a quote and they
will follow up <https://learning.hmhco.com/contact-us-reading-inventory> and
get us in the processes of purchasing and getting the information up and
running. We should be able to purchase this, upload a roster of our
freshmen students, and then generate usernames and passwords that we can
mail to kids. Once you get in contact with someone and get it purchased, I
can help you with pulling a roster of 9th grade students.

We need to have this thing up and running by September 7th, so please reply
all to keep everyone up to date.

-Steve


P.S. This is a copy of the form from the AP at Rauner and I know this was
the same type of software we used last year for reference.

Direct Website to SRI Test <https://h100007646.education.scholastic.com/>
Video Tutorial for Students to find sri from the remote website
<https://www.loom.com/share/58da8faae6ba49c9b782a07730b90850>
Teacher Resources
Directions & Website
<https://sites.google.com/view/rcp-remote-learning-hq/scholastic-reading-inventory?authuser=0>
Lexile Overview
<https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1ENoNtZcseCoLka7fxbDV9YBjl3AH1ClaI8QoLm_exV8/edit?usp=sharing>
9th 10th 11th 12th
Resources - Including How to Pull Reports
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B9xYcOaW7XywfjYzS2RjOVRvUkU2c0dNaFN4R3daN2xrVVRnWWs3TlN0Q1dvRmhWNFR6MUk?usp=sharing>
User Name Student ID Student ID Student ID Student ID
Password Wildcats@2024 Wildcats@2023 Wildcats@2022 Wildcats@2021

Message to Post to your Google Classroom
We're so excited to get to know each and every one of you as students and
as readers. Every year, we start the school year with our Scholastic
Reading Achievement Inventory to learn about each student's interests in
reading and your current level as a reader. Please take your time
completing this assessment, so we have accurate information to support your
growth. (Please note, testing is limited to 7 am to 8 pm Monday - Friday.)

1) Go to https://h100007646.education.scholastic.com
2) Your user name is your student ID
Your password is (ENTER YOUR GRADE LEVEL PASSWORD)
3) Take the practice test
4) When your test begins, you will have the opportunity to skip up to three
questions
To see how to log in, you can click on this link here
<https://www.loom.com/share/5c50ef6439f54a7b9ba5d8d08642ee33>

Subject: Problem w/ Computer
Detail:
Good Morning,

Yesterday after turning on my computer and entering my password my computer

Detail:

I am looking to purchase a subscription to Padlet. At first, this was
something that would come out of the Student & Culture support budget (with
Justin, myself, and Quinton being users). However, after hearing a few folx
in our L-Team meeting express interest in using Padlet this year, I am
wondering if we can purchase a school wide subscription that would not hit
the student culture and support budget, but that would allow all of
our teachers access to creating pro accounts with unlimited Padlets.

of Padlet. Here <https://padlet.com/premium/backpack/pricing> is where you

google *until

Monday-Friday July 7th-August 20th 8:00 am-2:00 pm.

Subject: computer auto turns on...programming?
Detail:
Morning friend,
I've been working with the microsoft support for my surface book for a bit,
but there is an interesting glitch that has been occuring with this
computer that didn't happen on the previous one (which I owned
independently). The computer automatically restarts every time I turn it
off. By simply choosing the power --> shut down option it automatically
turns back on as if I chose the restart option. If I push and hold the
power button for the hard shut down option it will stay off for an
undetermined amount of time but then turn back on randomly. This isn't a
terrible problem other than the fact that it completely depletes its
battery in my backpack over the course of several hours and when I pull it
out to use it, expecting it to be fully charged, it is dead. I have been
interacting with Microsoft support to see if they could see any simple
settings that could have been toggled or if when we first got it or if
there was a scheduled restart or anything of the sort but they haven't
found anything. They walked me through the process of fully updating all
the settings and making sure the drivers are all up to date (not just for
microsoft stuff, but also for the uniquely surface programming) and it is
still doing it.
My reason for emailing you this morning is to ask if there is any reason to
think that the program for updating the security software or something else
might be doing this. I haven't logged on with it in over a month and there
is an alert that has been reminding me about (proxy settings?) need to be
updated. Could this cause the pc to restart on its own? Do you have any
idea why this should be happening?

Kind regards,
Brian Stachowiak
Chemistry Instructor
*Mansueto High School*
*Noble Network of Charter Schools*

Subject: Rooms 208, 209, 208
Detail:
Hi Jose and Nate!

Two of our new teachers will be in next week on Wednesday for New Staff
Week. Their classroom will be in room 208 and it looks somewhat cray at the
moment.

*Nate *-- can you/Anna take care of the following for the room by Tuesday
noon? It's on your list of to-dos, so should not be new.


   - *Room should be completely ‘clean’ of teacher items (no papers,
   posters, borders, loose items).  *
   - *What remains in room = teacher desk, chair, 25 student desks/chairs,
   bookshelf(s) emptied, file cabinet emptied. *
   - *Remove extra desk/chairs.  Stage on 3rd floor*


*Not on the list: *

   - *The classroom is going to need an extra teacher desk + chair. Can you
   chat with Amy to see which desk you should pull from 311 for Maria
   Figueroa?*
   - *Room 209 and from 308 also need an extra teacher desk + chair. Can
   you chat with Amy to see which desk you should pull from 311 for
   Pallardy/Kent (209) and Carroll (308). *
   - *209 will need students desks and chairs, but I'll let you know where
   to pull from for those.*


*Jose *-- the new laptops need to be moved to another room. Ah...but I
don't know where. Maybe 303 for now? Also, what do you need from me in
terms of getting those ready? Should I send Steph and another person to
help you remove them from boxes? I can ask Alex to send them to you asap.
Should we put them in boxes/containers for now?


Appreciate you both!

Subject: Zoom Passcode Issue
Detail:
Good afternoon!

Our Alumni Career Office uses Calendly so alumni can schedule meetings with
us.  When they do so, it is set to automatically schedule these meetings
via Zoom.  Starting yesterday, we have had issues with alumni accessing the
meetings because a passcode is now required.  However, our invites don't
note what the passcode is.

I went into my Zoom settings and noticed that they have been adjusted so
that passcodes are required, however the option to turn this off is locked
by the admin.

Is it possible to turn that setting off so a passcode isn't needed?  If
not, do you know of other solutions we can take so that we can still
leverage Calendly for alumni to automatically schedule Zoom meetings with
our team?

Best,

Ashley Dodge (she/her/hers)
Manager, Alumni Career Office
*Noble Network of Charter Schools*
312.590.9505 (mobile)
https://nobleschools.org/alumni/career-office/
1 N. State Street, Floor 7-L, Chicago, IL 60602

Subject: Keyboard issues
Detail:
Hello!

Some of my keys on my Mac keyboard stick, which makes it hard to type
sometimes; however, it’s still usable. I took it into Apple, and they
mentioned that it’s a common issue for that generation. They said they can
replace it for free, but I would have to leave it with them for about a
week. I was wondering if this is something I should do? Or, do you want to
take a look at it?

Best,
Lorena

Subject: Replacement computer request
Detail:
Hi iTeam!

I was hoping to hold off for another year, but I think I probably need to
get a new computer. As you can see from the picture the case of my laptop
has been warping (maybe because I've rarely closed it for the last 1.5
years?) and now there's a permanent open gap under the touchpad.

I was going to work through that, but over the last couple of days there
has been intermittent steady noise coming from the hard drive that makes me
worry that there's a hardware issue pending there. I'm thinking that means
it's time to go for a replacement.

Unfortunately, I don't think I can get by with our standard PC
configuration because of the programming work that I do on my laptop and
would like a replacement to have the following specs:
-i7 or equivalent
-16GB RAM or better
-14" screen
-3 lb weight or close to it

(This HP zbook that I got in late 2018 has roughly those specs and
generally meets my needs, even with the older i7.)

All of my main files are in a Dropbox folder, so I can manage the transfer
of files to a new computer if you all get it and do the initial setup.

Thanks!

Matt

[image: frowning_laptop.jpg]

Detail:

I had an issue today with Zoom :
When I clicked on the meeting link (from Google calendar), I got a pop-up
message saying the meeting was scheduled for Jan 1, 2099. Unfortunately, it
is not showing now, so I cannot send a screenshot.

Apparently this is a known bug for Zoom for G Suite. Researching the issue,
I found a link in which the issue and a potential fix/workaround is
outlined :

privileges. Could someone from your team kindly help me with this? Thank
you!

Subject: Technical Difficulties with my computer
Detail:
Hello,

Since the morning, my computer has been acting really weird. Whenever I try
to increase the volume, it goes up by itself to 100. If I want to schedule
a google calendar invite and view others' calendars, their name appears but
disappears right away. If I try to browse through my google drive- the
documents move by themselves.

I restarted my computer a few times already and fixed the volume problem.
Since I restarted it, I keep getting text messages from *837402 *saying the
following: Use #code to verify isalgado@nobleschools.org using Chrome on
Windows 10.

Can you please let me know how I can fix the text issue and my Gmail?

Best,
Ivanna Salgado
